text: The 39 members of the Parliament of Vanuatu from 1979 to 1983 were elected on 14 November 1979. ==List of members== {| class="wikitable sortable" !Constituency !Member !Party !Notes |- |rowspan=2|Ambrym||Amos Andeng||New Hebrides Federal Party|| |- |Jack Hopa||Vanua'aku Pati|| |- |rowspan=3|Aoba–Maewo||Onneyn Tahi||Vanua'aku Pati|| |- |Thomas Tungu||Moderate Party|| |- |Judah Vira||Vanua'aku Pati|| |- |rowspan=2|||Norman Roslyn||Vanua'aku Pati|| |- |George Worek||Vanua'aku Pati|| |- |rowspan=3|Efate Rural||Nanua Albert||Vanua'aku Pati|| |- |George Kalkoa||Vanua'aku Pati||Elected president in 1980. By-election held on 26 August 1982 and won by Dick Poilapa (Vanua'aku Pati) |- |Donald Kalpokas||Vanua'aku Pati|| |- |Epi||Jack Taritonga||Vanua'aku Pati|| |- |rowspan=2|Luganville||George Cronsteadt||Moderate Party||Deported and declared a prohibited immigrant.Boulekone on 'surviving colonial mentality' Pacific Islands Monthly, March 1981, p14 By-election held on 31 August 1982 and won by Sela Molisa (Vanua'aku Pati). |- |Kalmer Vocor||Natui Tanno|| |- |rowspan=5|Malakula||Gérard Leymang||Namangi Aute|| |- |Aimé Maléré||Namangi Aute|| |- |Keith Obed||Vanua'aku Pati|| |- |Sethy Regenvanu||Vanua'aku Pati|| |- |Jimmy Simeon||Vanua'aku Pati|| |- |Paama||Edward Harris||Vanua'aku Pati|| |- |rowspan=3|Pentecost||Vincent Boulekone||Independent|| |- |Samuel Bule||Vanua'aku Pati|| |- |Walter Lini||Vanua'aku Pati|| |- |rowspan=4|Port Vila||||Independent|| |- |Kalpokor Kalsakau||Vanua'aku Pati|| |- |Guy Prévot||||Deported and declared a prohibited immigrant.Mark L. title: List of members of the Parliament of Vanuatu (1979–1983)
